sect2.title: Exporting TortoiseGit Settings
sect2.para: If you want to export all your client settings to use on another computer you can do so using the Windows registry editor regedt32.exe. Go to the registry key HKCU\Software\TortoiseGit and export it to a reg file. On the other computer, just import that file again (usually, a double click on the reg file will do that).
Remember to save Git's general settings, which you can find in the Git configuration file .gitconfig and/or the folder .config/git which both are located in your userprofile directory.
